top_task.title: Autonomous PM-Executor loop — external watcher, stdin injection, auto-assign workflow

data.title: [Phase 3.5] Autonomous Context Window Management
data.description:
Auto-checkpoint at 60% → auto-compact → auto-resume. No human intervention needed.

Subtasks:
1. Auto-checkpoint in post-tool-use hook: When pressure hits 60%, automatically save checkpoint (use existing checkpoint.saveCheckpoint() + pressure.checkAndNudge()). Don't just nudge — actually save.
2. Programmatic compact trigger: After auto-checkpoint, enqueue a compact action via stdin-injector so the terminal runs /compact automatically.
3. Auto-resume on session-start: In session-start hook, detect checkpoint for claimed task → load it → inject restoration prompt → agent continues from exact step.
4. PM pressure monitor: PM loop periodically checks all agents' pressure levels.
5. PM self-management: PM checkpoints its own orchestrator state before its own compact.

Key files: post-tool-use.js, pressure.js, checkpoint.js, session-start.js, stdin-injector.js

Start with /pilot-plan to create an implementation plan, then /pilot-exec for each step.

data.title: [Phase 3.1] Agent Identity & Skill Registry
data.description:
Named agent roles with skill-based task routing.

Subtasks:
1. Add role field to session state: frontend, backend, testing, design, infra, pm. Set via /pilot-start or auto-detect from agent config.
2. Skill registry JSON: .claude/pilot/config/skill-registry.json — maps each role to capabilities.
3. Agent capability declaration: On session-start, agent broadcasts its role and skills via message bus.
4. Task-to-agent matching: Given a task labels/description, score which agent role is best fit.
5. Session role persistence: Store role in session state file. On restart, agent reclaims same role.
6. Agent affinity tracking: Record which agent worked on what.

Key files: session.js, agents.yaml, messaging.js, orchestrator.js

Start with /pilot-plan then /pilot-exec.

data.title: [Phase 3.7] Per-Agent Persistent Memory
data.description:
Each agent type maintains learned knowledge across sessions.

Subtasks:
1. Agent memory writer in post-tool-use hook: After each significant action (commit, plan decision, error), auto-record to agent memory using memory.setAgentMemory() and memory.recordDiscovery().
2. Decision log per agent: When agent makes a choice, record it. Format: { decision, reason, alternatives, task_id, timestamp }.
3. Issue/error log: When something fails, record the failure pattern.
4. Memory loading on session-start: Agent reads its type memory and injects as context.
5. Cross-agent memory queries: API to read another agent type memory.
6. Memory pruning with TTL.

Key files: memory.js, post-tool-use.js, session-start.js, .claude/pilot/memory/agents/

Start with /pilot-plan then /pilot-exec.

data.title: [Phase 3.10] Reliable Message Bus
data.description:
ACK/NACK protocol, dead letter queue, bus compaction, priority processing.

Subtasks:
1. ACK protocol: When ack.required=true, track receipt. If not ACKed within deadline, retry or move to DLQ.
2. Dead letter queue: .claude/pilot/messages/dlq.jsonl — messages that failed delivery after N retries.
3. Bus compaction: Use existing compactBus() (messaging.js:575). Wire into periodic maintenance — run when bus exceeds 100KB.
4. Priority processing: When reading messages, process blocking priority first, then normal, then fyi.
5. Message ordering: Add sequence numbers per sender for FIFO guarantee.
6. Cursor corruption recovery: Gracefully reset to last known good position.

Key files: messaging.js, pm-watcher.js, pm-loop.js

Start with /pilot-plan then /pilot-exec.

data.title: [Phase 3.5] Autonomous Context Window Management
data.description:
Auto-checkpoint at 60% → auto-compact → auto-resume. No human intervention.

Subtasks:
1. Auto-checkpoint in post-tool-use: At 60%, save checkpoint automatically (not just nudge).
2. Programmatic compact trigger: Enqueue compact action via stdin-injector.
3. Auto-resume on session-start: Detect checkpoint → load → inject restoration prompt → continue.
4. PM pressure monitor: PM checks all agents pressure levels.
5. PM self-management: PM checkpoints its own state before compact.

Key files: post-tool-use.js, pressure.js, checkpoint.js, session-start.js, stdin-injector.js

Start with /pilot-plan then /pilot-exec.

subject: PM Review: Convert tests to Vitest format
body:
Your M3 E2E tests (tests/integration/m3-e2e.test.js) have solid coverage — all 57 assertions pass. However, the file uses a custom test runner with manual test()/assert() functions instead of Vitest describe/it/expect. Vitest cannot detect any test suites and reports FAIL.

Required changes:
1. Replace the custom test() runner with Vitest describe() + it() blocks
2. Replace assert()/assertEqual()/assertIncludes() with Vitest expect() matchers
3. Remove the shebang and custom runner boilerplate
4. Ensure npx vitest run tests/integration/m3-e2e.test.js passes with all 57 tests detected
5. Commit to your worktree branch (pilot/pilot-agi-812)

This is blocking merge approval. Please fix before closing the task.

subject: Reassigned: Pilot AGI-812 — Convert E2E tests to Vitest format
body:
You are reassigned to Pilot AGI-812. The test file tests/integration/m3-e2e.test.js has 57 passing assertions but uses a custom runner instead of Vitest.

Required:
1. Replace custom test()/assert() with Vitest describe()/it()/expect()
2. Remove shebang and custom runner boilerplate
3. Ensure npx vitest run tests/integration/m3-e2e.test.js passes with all 57 tests detected
4. Commit to worktree branch

Claim the task with bd update Pilot AGI-812 --status in_progress and create a worktree.
